metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3752 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s Bluetooth subsystemin the way user calls connect to the socket and disconnect simultaneouslydue to a race condition. This flaw allows a user to crash the system orescalate their privileges. The highest threat from this vulnerability is toconfidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3752` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-167-generic - 4.15.0-167.175
linux-image-4.15.0-167-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-167.175
linux-image-4.15.0-167-lowlatency - 4.15.0-167.175
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-167-generic - 4.15.0-167.175
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-167-lowlatency - 4.15.0-167.175
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-97-generic - 5.4.0-97.110~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-167.175').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-97.110~18.04.1').
